questions.question: What is the definition of menstruation?
options: Cyclic uterine bleeding in response to hormonal changes when the ovum is not fertilized

questions.question: Menstruation occurs when the ovum is fertilized.
The normal range for a menstrual cycle is 21 to 35 days.
Menorrhagia is defined as a blood loss of less than 30 cc.
The ovarian cycle consists of three phases: follicular, ovulation, and luteal.
The luteal phase is under the primary influence of Follicle Stimulating Hormone (FSH).
The corpus luteum produces both estrogen and progesterone.
The secretory phase of the endometrial cycle occurs before ovulation.
Prostaglandins help control bleeding by causing vasodilation.
A positive spinnbarkeit test involves cervical mucus stretching 5-10 cm.
It is recommended to avoid showering during menstruation to prevent infection.
Violent and excessive exercise should be avoided during menses.
Yoga is not recommended during menstruation as it increases cramps.
Applying local heat to the abdomen may relieve menstrual pain.
Ibuprofen is an example of a prostaglandin inhibitor.
Drinking plenty of water can help reduce bloating during menstruation.
Oligomenorrhea is defined as a cycle frequency of less than 21 days.
The Graafian follicle is filled with estrogenic fluid.
The precise mechanism causing the Graafian follicle to rupture is well understood.
The menstrual phase marks the end of the endometrial cycle.
The regenerative phase starts just after menses and is under the influence of progesterone.
In the secretory phase, the endometrial glands become straight and short.
The ischemic phase begins around the 26th day of the cycle if pregnancy has not occurred.
A used sanitary pad should be flushed down the toilet.
Girls should wash their hands with soap after changing a pad.
Herbal remedies like ginger tea can reduce muscle contractions associated with menstrual pain.
The document recommends eating at least five portions of fruit and vegetables every day during menstruation.
The H.P.O axis involves the hypothalamus, pituitary, and ovaries.
The follicular phase length is constant at 14 days for all women.
Metrorrhagia refers to regular bleeding related to menstruation.
The drop in estrogen and progesterone levels causes the endometrium to shed.
